{"step_by_step_thinking": "Antiserum A and antiserum B are used to determine the ABO blood group, while the Rh factor is determined by the Rh antiserum. If no agglutination is seen when both antiserum A and antiserum B, as well as the Rh antiserum, are added to the blood sample, it indicates that the blood sample does not agglutinate with either antiserum A or antiserum B, and it is also Rh negative. Therefore, the correct answer is B. O group and Rh-ve.", "answer_choice": "B"}
